Yahtzee is a strategy game played with 5 dices. It can be played in single trying to reach the best score or against one or more opponents.

There are different combinations that can be realized by the players throwing the dices. When the combination is obtained, the player gains points depending on the combination. A combination can't be repeated, so the game ends after 13 turns of dice throws, even if not every combination has been realized.

At each turn, the player can throw the dices for three times. At the first throw, the player throws all dices, while in the two following throws the player can choose to keep one or more favorable dices to obtain the desired combination. The player can also choose not to keep any dice or use following throws, in case, for example, a good combination has already been realized. At the end of the three throws, the player must sign a point in one of the unused boxes of the scorekeeper. If at the end of a turn one of the possible unused combinations isn't realized, the player must sign "0" (zero) in one of the unused boxes.

The player with the higher total of points at the end of the game is the winner.

Combinations:
 - Equal dices with 1 (score given by the sum of all dices with 1): it can be obtained when at least one dice is 1. The score is the sum of the dices with 1. For example: 1-3-4-6-1 gives 2 points.
 - Equal dices with 2 (score given by the sum of all dices with 2): it can be obtained when at least one dice is 2. The score is the sum of the dices with 2. For example: 2-1-2-2-5 gives 6 points.
 - Equal dices with 3 (score given by the sum of all dices with 3): it can be obtained when at least one dice is 3. The score is the sum of the dices with 3. For example: 3-1-3-4-3 gives 9 points.
 - Equal dices with 4 (score given by the sum of all dices with 4): it can be obtained when at least one dice is 4. The score is the sum of the dices with 4. For example: 4-1-2-2-1 gives 4 points.
 - Equal dices with 5 (score given by the sum of all dices with 5): it can be obtained when at least one dice is 5. The score is the sum of the dices with 5. For example: 5-1-5-5-2 gives 15 points.
 - Equal dices with 6 (score given by the sum of all dices with 6): it can be obtained when at least one dice is 6. The score is the sum of the dices with 6. For example: 6-3-2-6-1 gives 12 points.
 - Bonus (35 points): it can be obtained when the sum of the scores of all 6 previous combinations exceeds or reaches 63.
 - 3 of a kind (score given by the sum of all dices): when 3 out of 5 dices are equal. For example 3-3-3-5-2.
 - 4 of a kind (score given by the sum of all dices): when 4 out of 5 dices are equal. For example 5-5-5-5-1.
 - Full (25 points): same as the poker combination, with 3 dices of one kind and 2 of another. For example 4-4-4-1-1.
 - Small Straight (30 points): when 4 dices are sorted in increasing order (1-2-3-4 or 2-3-4-5 or 3-4-5-6).
 - Large Straight (40 points): when 5 dices are sorted in increasing order (1-2-3-4-5 or 2-3-4-5-6).
 - Yahtzee (50 points): when all 5 dices are equal. For example 1-1-1-1-1 or 4-4-4-4-4. If Yahtzee is repeated, it can be inserted in another free combination together with the score relating to it.
 - Chance (score given by the sum of all 5 dices): any combination obtained. It's a chance to exploit when none of the previous combinations is realized, or if the realized combination has already been realized previously. This combination can be used only once too.
